meanings.definition: Afraid of or averse to air or gases.
meanings.sent1: She felt aerophobic whenever she had to fly in an airplane.
meanings.sent2: The aerophobic child refused to blow up balloons at the party.
meanings.sent3: The aerophobic cat always avoided open windows, fearing the breeze.
meanings.sent4: His aerophobic tendencies made him feel suffocated in crowded, stuffy rooms.
meanings.sent5: The aerophobic astronaut panicked when his helmet fogged up during the spacewalk.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by a fear of air or gases.
meanings.sent1: The aerophobic reaction to the gas leak was immediate among the residents.
meanings.sent2: Her aerophobic symptoms worsened whenever she entered a smoky room.
meanings.sent3: The aerophobic alarm system went off at the slightest hint of airborne particles.
meanings.sent4: The aerophobic bubble wrap packaging protected the delicate items from exposure to air.
meanings.sent5: The aerophobic weather balloon burst as soon as it reached high altitudes.
